headline.main: AMERICAN INSTITUTE OF INSTRUCTION.; CONVENTION AT NEW-HAVEN. Interesting Proceedings.

docs.lead_paragraph: The American Institute of Instruction met at the State-House in this city this morning, at 10 o'clock, GIDEON F. THAYBR, Esq., President of the Association, presiding. Many ladies, as well as gentlemen, teachers from different parts of the country, were present, and the Representatives' Hall was nearly filled at the opening.

byline.original: SPECIAL CORRESPONDENCE OF THE N. Y. DAILY TIMES

headline.main: THE DEATHS BY THE RECENT HEAT.; The Inquests Concluded--List of the Latest Victims.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Coroners have brought their labors to a close. For nearly a week they have been occupied, with scarcely an intermission, in the holding of inquests on the bodies of persons who died from the effects of the heat. Forty eight inquests were held yesterday which bring us to the end of the fatal list. The names, ages,

headline.main: BROOKLYN CITY.; FOUND DROWNED. CAUTION IN BUYING PEACHES ICE-BOAT SUNK. LOOK OUT. MORTALITY. QUEENS COUNTY AGRICULTURAL SOCIETY.

docs.lead_paragraph: The following from the Crescent of the 9th, gives us a view of the mortality attending the epidemic, such as we do not receive from reading the statistics: On Sunday afternoon information was sent to the Mayor that numerous dead bodies were lying on the ground in the Lafayette Cemetery, unburied, for the want of force to perform the work of sepulture. The Chairman of the Committee on Ceme.

docs.lead_paragraph: SINGULAR CAUSE OF DEATH--On Saturday last, a young man, son of Mr. BOND, of the firm of BOND TIDD, curriers, Woburn, died; the circumstances attending his decease were remarkable. On Thursday last, while in his usual good health, he was called to remove some hides from a wagon;
